fields_of_interest: Culture, Education and training, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Digital economy and society, Sport
eu_initiatives:
Poverty and social exclusion - 
24% of all the EU population (over 120 million people), are at risk of poverty or social exclusion – this includes 27% of all children in Europe, 20.5% of those over 65, and 9% of those with a job 
 
Youth on the move  
 
Children free time  
 
EU Action Plan on Childhood Obesity - children's practical works of art are made in nature. 
 
“Growing with Children’s Rights - children are treated correspondending to age - responsibility and rights.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership: MTÜ Butafoori Lasteklubi is an independent non-profit organization which has had co-operation with Tallinn Centre's city government. In 2011 MTÜ Butafoori lasteklubi gained around 359 euros from Tallinn Centre's city goverment for art exhibition. Also in 2015 we received 100 euros for art exhibition from Tallinn Centre's city goverment. In 2016 we made contact with local chess club and attracted 2 members to join from there.
goals__remit:
MTÜ Butafoori lasteklubi is youth and children oriented organization which deals with arts - sculpture makeing, theatre costumes, videos, photos and other youngs people's areas of interest. 
 
- individual development of kids 
- international displayment of children art work 
- takeing part of Kanagawa Biennial World Children Art Exhibition. 
- Perspective plans are put every year for all children who go in our club. 
- activily taking part in local exhibitions in Estonia, Finland and Latvia to promote works of our children in modern arts 
-improving local area - planting trees and flowers. 
 
---- 
We are interested in Europe's structural foundations, which expand possibilities for European youth - European youth policy.
